verbs.description: alliterate (third-person singular simple present alliterates, present participle alliterating, simple past and past participle alliterated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To use (a word or sound) so as to make alliteration.
examples: It is a strophe of six lines, of which the first and second and the fourth and fifth belong together, while the third and sixth are independently alliterated.
